ChannelId.description: Hardware channel ID in the Device.

DMMChannel.description: A DMM channel that can be physical or virtual.

bottom_detuning.description: Minimum possible detuning per trap (in rad/µs), must be below zero.

clock_period.description: The duration of a clock cycle (in ns).

custom_phase_jump_time.description: An optional custom value for the phase jump time that overrides the  default value estimated from the modulation bandwidth.

fixed_retarget_t.description: Time taken to change the target (in ns).

id.description: The identifier of the channel within its device.

max_abs_detuning.description: Maximum possible detuning (in rad/µs), in absolute value.

max_duration.description: The longest duration an instruction can take.

max_targets.description: How many atoms can be locally addressed at once by the same beam.

min_avg_amp.description: The minimum average amplitude of a pulse (when not zero).

min_duration.description: The shortest duration an instruction can take.

min_retarget_interval.description: Minimum time required between the ends of two target instructions (in ns).

mod_bandwidth.description: The modulation bandwidth at -3dB (50% reduction), in MHz.

propagation_dir.description: The propagation direction of the beam leaving the channel.

total_bottom_detuning.description: Minimum possible detuning of the whole DMM channel (in rad/µs), must be below zero.

accepts_new_layouts.description: Whether registers built from register layouts that are not already calibrated are accepted.  Only enforced in QPU execution.

channels.description: The available channels on the device.

default_noise_model.description: An optional noise model characterizing the default noise of the device.

dimensions.description: The maximum dimension of the supported trap arrays.

dmm_objects.description: The DMM subclass instances specifying each channel in the device.

interaction_coeff_xy.description: Coefficient setting the interaction stregth between atoms in different Rydberg states. Needed only if the device has a Microwave channel (otherwise can be null).

is_virtual.description: Marks the device as physical (ie non-virtual).

max_layout_filling.description: The largest fraction of a layout that can be filled with atoms.

max_layout_traps.description: The maximum number of traps a layout can have.

max_radial_distance.description: Maximum distance an atom can be from the center of the array (in µm).

max_runs.description: The maximum number of runs allowed on the device. Only used for backend execution.

max_sequence_duration.description: The maximum allowed duration for a sequence (in ns).

min_atom_distance.description: The closest together two atoms can be (in μm).

min_layout_filling.description: The smallest fraction of a layout that must be filled with atoms.

min_layout_traps.description: The minimum number of traps a layout can have.

name.description: A unique name for the device.

optimal_layout_filling.description: The optimal fraction of a layout that should be filled with atoms.

pre_calibrated_layouts.description: Register layouts already calibrated on the device.

pulser_version.description: The pulser version used to serialize the object.

requires_layout.description: Whether the register used in the sequence must be created from a register layout.  Only enforced in QPU execution.

reusable_channels.description: Whether each channel can be declared multiple times on the same pulse sequence.

rydberg_level.description: The principal quantum number of the used Rydberg level.

supports_slm_mask.description: Whether the device has an SLM mask.

channels.description: The available channels on the device.

default_noise_model.description: An optional noise model characterizing the default noise of the device.

dimensions.description: The maximum dimension of the supported trap arrays.

dmm_objects.description: The DMM subclass instances specifying each channel in the device.

interaction_coeff_xy.description: Coefficient setting the interaction stregth between atoms in different Rydberg states. Needed only if the device has a Microwave channel (otherwise can be null).

max_layout_filling.description: The largest fraction of a layout that can be filled with atoms.

max_layout_traps.description: The maximum number of traps a layout can have.

max_radial_distance.description: Maximum distance an atom can be from the center of the array (in µm).

max_runs.description: The maximum number of runs allowed on the device. Only used for backend execution.

max_sequence_duration.description: The maximum allowed duration for a sequence (in ns).

min_atom_distance.description: The closest together two atoms can be (in μm).

min_layout_filling.description: The smallest fraction of a layout that must be filled with atoms.

min_layout_traps.description: The minimum number of traps a layout can have.

name.description: A unique name for the device.

optimal_layout_filling.description: The optimal fraction of a layout that should be filled with atoms.

pulser_version.description: The pulser version used to serialize the object.

requires_layout.description: Whether the register used in the sequence must be created from a register layout.  Only enforced in QPU execution.

reusable_channels.description: Whether each channel can be declared multiple times on the same pulse sequence.

rydberg_level.description: The principal quantum number of the used Rydberg level.

supports_slm_mask.description: Whether the device has an SLM mask.

clock_period.description: The duration of a clock cycle (in ns).

custom_phase_jump_time.description: An optional custom value for the phase jump time that overrides the  default value estimated from the modulation bandwidth.

blue_shift_coeff.description: The weight coefficient of the blue beam's contribution to the lightshift.

controlled_beams.description: The beams that can be switched on/off with an EOM.

custom_buffer_time.description: A custom wait time to enforce during EOM buffers.

intermediate_detuning.description: The detuning between the two beams, in rad/µs.

limiting_beam.description: The beam with the smallest amplitude range.

max_limiting_amp.description: The maximum amplitude the limiting beam can reach, in rad/µs.

mod_bandwidth.description: The EOM modulation bandwidth at -3dB (50% reduction), in MHz.

multiple_beam_control.description: Whether both EOMs can be used simultaneously or not.

red_shift_coeff.description: The weight coefficient of the red beam's contribution to the lightshift.

fixed_retarget_t.description: Time taken to change the target (in ns).

id.description: The identifier of the channel within its device.

max_abs_detuning.description: Maximum possible detuning (in rad/µs), in absolute value.

max_duration.description: The longest duration an instruction can take.

max_targets.description: How many atoms can be locally addressed at once by the same beam.

min_avg_amp.description: The minimum average amplitude of a pulse (when not zero).

min_duration.description: The shortest duration an instruction can take.

min_retarget_interval.description: Minimum time required between the ends of two target instructions (in ns).

mod_bandwidth.description: The modulation bandwidth at -3dB (50% reduction), in MHz.

propagation_dir.description: The propagation direction of the beam leaving the channel.
